article_title: The Price of College Increasing in Some States More Than Others
article_text:
The prices of books, supplies, tuition, fees and room and board have all increased, according to data from the U.S. Department of Education.

Over the last five years, the cost of in-state tuition at public schools has increased in every state, but more drastically in some. The winners – or perhaps losers – in this case are the District of Columbia, Arizona and Georgia. In the nation's capital, tuition and fees increased 81 percent. They increased by about 70 percent in Arizona and by 65 percent in Georgia.

article_metadata.title: The Price of College Increasing in Some States More Than Others

og.description: We all knew college was getting more expensive, but is it worse where you live?
og.title: Your State's Soaring Price for College

article_summary:
The prices of books, supplies, tuition, fees and room and board have all increased, according to data from the U.S. Department of Education.
In the nation's capital, tuition and fees increased 81 percent.
Over the last five years, the cost of in-state tuition at public schools has increased in every state, but more drastically in some.
The winners – or perhaps losers – in this case are the District of Columbia, Arizona and Georgia.
They increased by about 70 percent in Arizona and by 65 percent in Georgia.
